image.altText: A woman wearing green swimmers in a pool holds her arm up in the air

props.synopsis: The Paris Olympic Games are officially open with the swimming getting underway and the Boomers kicking off their basketball campaign on the first full day of competition. Follow live.

title.children: First full day of Olympic competition in Paris features Australian swimming stars and Boomers

image.altText: A woman with a blue shirt wearing a white jacket smiles at the camera

props.synopsis: In estimates hearings today, a Canberra Institute of Technology official confirmed former chief executive Leanne Cover received the lump sum as well as being paid her annual salary for two years while on leave.

title.children: 'Corrupt' former CIT CEO was paid almost half a million dollars upon resigning, official reveals

image.altText: Grindr

props.synopsis: ACT police believe the three alleged homophobic assaults are linked and targeted, with the most recent incident allegedly occurring in the early hours of Saturday July 20, less than two hours after the second reported attack outside the same vacant Red Hill residence.

title.children: Third alleged homophobic attack in Canberra happened only hours after another, police say

image.altText: A woman with long dark hair sits looking serious with her glasses in one hand.

props.synopsis: Violent civil unrest and a brutal government crackdown in Bangladesh have left the diaspora in Canberra reeling.

title.children: 'Devasted, helpless': Shamaruh and Nazmul are unable to help their families in Bangladesh

image.altText: A line of people

props.synopsis: Electrical Trades Union members have walked out of the New South Wales Labor Party conference in Sydney as Prime Minister Anthony Albanese delivered a speech to party faithful.

title.children: Union members walk out on Albanese's speech at NSW Labor conference

image.altText: People hold umbrellas in front of the Eiffel Tower, which is lit up in a light show

props.synopsis: Simply pulling off this opening ceremony is a feat for Paris to be proud of. But as the city of lights danced in the rain, it sent the world a message and proved again the real value of the Olympic Games.

title.children: Paris, soaked but spectacular, delivers an opening ceremony for the dreamers

image.altText: Large plastic bags with Australian Federal Police stickers containing medication bags

props.synopsis: A 33-year-old Chinese national is arrested after police seized an estimated $5 million worth of steroids and other drugs they allege were being sold by mail order.

title.children: ACT police seize 55,000 vials and 156,000 tablets of steroids and other drugs allegedly sold through the mail

image.altText: Big sign saying Australian National University.

props.synopsis: The Australian National University says it is "deeply sorry" for the error that saw 2,290 former and current casual staff miss payments totalling about $2 million during the past 11 years, and had self-reported to the Fair Work Ombudsman.

title.children: More than 2,000 casual Australian National University staff underpaid over 11 years due to timesheet error

image.altText: A young boy sits on the floor smiling, holding up a tennis racket

props.synopsis: The news headline told of cold-blooded murder, but the face staring back at me was that of my childhood friend, writes Josh Robertson.

title.children: I expected to see Nathaniel at Wimbledon, not becoming 'Australia's first Christian terrorist'

image.altText: Zach Merrett and Jade Gresham of the Bombers celebrate with a hug on the field

props.synopsis: Zach Merrett has produced one of the great goals from the boundary against St Kilda as Essendon try to cement themselves in the top eight. Follow live.

title.children: Merrett kicks 'absolute miracle' goal but Essendon's finals dream threatens to take major blow

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Suns-Lions: Ben King takes a hanger and kicks the goal
StK-Ess: Bombers forced to sub out Jordan Ridley
Zach Merrett kicks one of the great goals

image.altText: A group of rugby league players celebrate scoring a try

props.synopsis: The Cowboys have lost two key players to HIA's in the first half but have still managed to find the lead in their showdown with the Sharks. Follow live.

title.children: Cowboys overcome shocking first-half injury toll to lead Cronulla

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: 28' Brailey binned for professional foul, Cows take the two
Injury update: Cowboys lose two to HIA's, activate 18th man
39' Brisbane score one of the tries of the year!

image.altText: A black coloured tractor in the Antarctic snow with whispy clouds across the blue sky. A large halo surrounds the sun.

props.synopsis: The temperature above the east Antarctic coastline warmed by about 50 degrees Celsius in a week earlier in July. The event, called a Sudden Stratospheric Warming has the potential to impact Australia's weather through August and possibly well into spring.

title.children: The temperature over Antarctica rose by 50C in a week — here's how it could impact Australia

image.altText: a 32yo man with facial hair wearing a white shirt and backwards cap

props.synopsis: Zak Grieve spent his 20s incarcerated alongside some of the Northern Territory's worst criminals. Now on parole, his life as a convicted murderer is under the microscope.

title.children: The judge knew Zak Grieve didn't commit murder. NT laws meant he got a life sentence anyway

image.altText: People in military uniforms walking in front of a train station.

props.synopsis: Hours before the Olympic Games opening ceremony was due to begin, a coordinated arson attack brought down France's rail network. Here's what we know so far.

title.children: What we know about the attacks on France's high-speed rail network

image.altText: Two woman shake hands with a man with an American flag draped behind them

props.synopsis: In the last three weeks, one woman has emerged as the key driver of efforts to push the Democratic Party towards a historic decision. Here's how Nancy Pelosi helped put Kamala Harris on the ticket.

title.children: The woman who showed Biden the door: 'Nancy made clear they could do this the easy way or the hard way'

image.altText: Shark victim Kai McKenzie holding his girlfriend while in hospital after his leg was severed in a shark attack

props.synopsis: Kai McKenzie talks about the "crazy attack" and thanks all the people who saved his life days after he lost a leg in a shark attack while he was surfing.

title.children: 'I'll be back in that water in no time': Surfer posts message after losing leg in shark attack

image.altText: a purple light illuminates a thick web of computer cables in a dark room

props.synopsis: There is a growing sense of unease about global stock markets, and particularly Wall Street, as investors rush to sell off the tech stocks that have recently pushed markets to record highs.

title.children: Wall Street wobbles on Artificial Intelligence concerns

image.altText: A selfie of woman with a fringe in a brown polka dot top

props.synopsis: Over time, women have shared stories of feeling dismissed and ignored by healthcare professionals. Now the results of a national survey hint at just how serious the problem is.

title.children: 'I broke down sobbing because a doctor believed me': Why do so many Australian women experience medical misogyny?

image.altText: An aerial image of an airboat travelling across a flood plain in Kakadu National Park.

props.synopsis: The federal government has refused an extension on the lease of the Jabiluka uranium mine, which has never been mined or developed, and will move to protect the site permanently as part of Kakadu National Park.

title.children: Albanese vows 'there will never be mining at Jabiluka' as mine lease ended

image.altText: two beef hamburgers on plates.

props.synopsis: The United States' cattle herd is at its lowest level since the 1950s. But its "insatiable appetite" for hamburgers hasn't changed, and that's causing ripples through the global beef trade.

title.children: Americans' love of hamburgers is chewing up global beef supplies, so what does that mean for Australia?

image.altText: Trump and Netanyahu sitting at a long table with other officials.

props.synopsis: Former US president Donald Trump has sat down with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu for their first face-to-face meeting in nearly four years.

title.children: Trump touts warm ties with Netanyahu during Mar-a-Lago meeting

image.altText: A small plane flies in front of a cloud of smoke.

props.synopsis: The incident is part of a wider crisis, with over 110 active fires burning across 7,250 square kilometres in the US, and significant damage reported in Canada's Jasper National Park.

title.children: Oregon firefighting pilot killed in tanker plane crash as fires spread

image.altText: An aerial shot of Huione Pay's headquarters in Phnom Penh.

props.synopsis: A huge online marketplace linked to Cambodia's ruling family is allegedly being used to sell equipment to and launder money for the online scam industry — with Australians among those in the crosshairs.

title.children: 'Not necessarily human trafficking': Online market claims electrified GPS shackles have legitimate uses

image.altText: a bright green frog in bushes

props.synopsis: At least 90 species of frogs have been made extinct by chytrid fungus worldwide. But a program to protect other frogs with  "saunas" made of bricks is proving promising.

title.children: Anthony's idea for frog-saving 'saunas' went global. Can he harness his viral moment?

image.altText: An older man and woman smiling while hugging on their front porch.

props.synopsis: Desperate to escape financial turmoil in the wake of the pandemic and rising interest rates, this city couple changed their lives completely and haven't looked back.

title.children: Couple goes from struggling to repay mortgage and $80,000 credit card debt to owning their own home

image.altText: Two women with dark hair sitting on a couch, with a bookshelf in the background. The lighting is soft.

props.synopsis: Hannah says she had nothing when she dropped out of school in year 8 and began stealing to support her family, but the ReKindle program is giving her the skills to live a life free from crime.

title.children: Hannah stole to help her family, but this program is giving her a second chance at life

image.altText: IV drip in hospital near closed blinds.

props.synopsis: Health authorities have assured the public there is ample supply of IV fluids for humans in hospitals, but have begun making moves to conserve stock levels of the crucial substance.

title.children: A critical fluid used in health care to rehydrate and administer drugs to patients is experiencing a global supply shortage. Here's how it'll affect you

image.altText: A photo of an unidentifiable man stroking his beard.

props.synopsis: Victorian men with religious beards are banned from working as paramedics due to a rigid face mask policy, despite alternative mask fit techniques being used in other states and countries.

title.children: 'Very frustrated': Sikh community accuses Victoria's ambulance service of discrimination due to religious beard ban

image.altText: Olga Korbut flies through the air backwards while doing a gymnastics routine, in a full stadium.

props.synopsis: The 1972 Munich Olympics are the first Games I can recall, and they changed me forever — especially the astonishing routines of a Soviet Union gymnast whose signature move was so dangerous that it's now banned.

title.children: My first Olympics are etched in my memory — and nothing has compared since

image.altText: Heidi Sze prepares a recipe for shaved brussel sprout salad.

props.synopsis: This wintertime salad is fresh and vibrant with crunchy brussels sprouts, a quick creamy dressing and a dusting of finely grated parmesan cheese.

title.children: Brighten up winter meals with this easy, crunchy salad

image.altText: Hatsune Miku is singing into a microphone and holding a guitar.

props.synopsis: While doomsayers may see virtual performers like Hatsune Miku and Plave as a threat to the creative industries, some artists are using the technology to their advantage.

title.children: Virtual idol Hatsune Miku has announced her first Aussie tour and she's not the only digital kid on the block

image.altText: Photos from the Paris Olympic Games Opening Ceremony spliced together

props.synopsis: From Lady Gaga making her highly anticipated appearance to an incredibly emotional conclusion with Celine Dion — here's the biggest moments from the opening ceremony.

title.children: From Gaga to beheadings to Céline's magic moment — all the highlights from the Olympic opening ceremony
